intro: Galium intertextum, commonly known as bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval or lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium intertextum is often found in moist meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
